clusters.title: UK recognises state of Palestine to ‘keep alive’ the possibility of peace
clusters.neutral_headline: UK Formally Recognizes Palestinian State

items.title: UK recognises state of Palestine to ‘keep alive’ the possibility of peace
items.standfirst: Keir Starmer says announcement shows government’s hopes for a secure Israel alongside a viable PalestineNetanyahu says recognition is a prize for terrorismThe UK has formally recognised Palestine as an independent state, Keir Starmer has said, in a deeply symbolic announcement which the government hopes will show its commitment to peace in the region and ease domestic political tensions.In a sign of the global concern over the humanitarian crisis in Gaza, Canada and Australia also made their own formal declarations recognising Palestine on Sunday ahead of a conference of the UN general assembly in New York. Continue reading...
items.content: Keir Starmer says announcement shows government’s hopes for a secure Israel alongside a viable PalestineNetanyahu says recognition is a prize for terrorismThe UK has formally recognised Palestine as an independent state, Keir Starmer has said, in a deeply symbolic announcement which the government hopes will show its commitment to peace in the region and ease domestic political tensions.In a sign of the global concern over the humanitarian crisis in Gaza, Canada and Australia also made their own formal declarations recognising Palestine on Sunday ahead of a conference of the UN general assembly in New York. Continue reading...

items.title: UK formally recognises Palestinian state
items.standfirst: Canada and Australia also announced the move on Sunday, with Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu accusing leaders of giving a "huge reward to terrorism".
items.content: Canada and Australia also announced the move on Sunday, with Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu accusing leaders of giving a "huge reward to terrorism".

items.title: Netanyahu: Palestinian statehood will not happen
items.standfirst: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said Israel will continue building settlements in the West Bank just hours after Canada, the United Kingdom and Australia recognized Palestinian statehood. &...
items.content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said Israel will continue building settlements in the West Bank just hours after Canada, the United Kingdom and Australia recognized Palestinian statehood. &...

items.title: U.K. formally recognizes Palestinian state
items.standfirst: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer announced the U.K. will recognize a Palestinian state after Israel failed to agree to a ceasefire in Gaza. Australia and Canada have made similar announcements ahead of the United Nations General Assembly.
items.content: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer announced the U.K. will recognize a Palestinian state after Israel failed to agree to a ceasefire in Gaza. Australia and Canada have made similar announcements ahead of the United Nations General Assembly.

items.title: How will recognition of Palestinian statehood be greeted in the UK?
items.standfirst: As well as being deeply symbolic, the move is also a major foreign policy shift for the Labour governmentThe UK’s formal recognition of Palestinian statehood is deeply symbolic on the world stage, but the major foreign policy shift is also a significant political step for the Labour government at home. The announcement followed mounting pressure on Keir Starmer from within the Labour party and beyond. Continue reading...
items.content: As well as being deeply symbolic, the move is also a major foreign policy shift for the Labour governmentThe UK’s formal recognition of Palestinian statehood is deeply symbolic on the world stage, but the major foreign policy shift is also a significant political step for the Labour government at home. The announcement followed mounting pressure on Keir Starmer from within the Labour party and beyond. Continue reading...

items.title: U.K. formally recognizes Palestinian state

items.content: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer announced the U.K. will recognize a Palestinian state after Israel failed to agree to a ceasefire in Gaza. Australia and Canada have made similar announcements ahead of the United Nations General Assembly.

items.title: Watch: Keir Starmer says UK recognises Palestinian state

items.content: Prime Minister Starmer says the move will "revive the hope of peace" but Israel says it is "nothing but a reward for jihadist Hamas".

items.title: UK PM says Britain recognises ‘State of Palestine’
items.standfirst: UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer on Sunday said Britain was formally recognising a State of Palestine, in a historic shift in decades of British foreign policy. “Today, to revive the hope of peace for the Palestinians and Israelis, and a two-state solution, the United Kingdom formally recognises the…
items.content: UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer on Sunday said Britain was formally recognising a State of Palestine, in a historic shift in decades of British foreign policy. “Today, to revive the hope of peace for the Palestinians and Israelis, and a two-state solution, the United Kingdom formally recognises the…

items.title: British PM Starmer says "two-state solution is the best hope for peace and security"
items.standfirst: Prime Minister Keir Starmer has issued a pre-recorded video message on his YouTube channel and other social media platforms, announcing that the United Kingdom now formally recognises the State of Palestine. This makes Britain the 148th of the UN’s 193 member states to do so. Israel has condemned the move, voicing strong criticism. France 24’s Bénédicte Paviot reports on the reaction in the United Kingdom.
items.content: Prime Minister Keir Starmer has issued a pre-recorded video message on his YouTube channel and other social media platforms, announcing that the United Kingdom now formally recognises the State of Palestine. This makes Britain the 148th of the UN’s 193 member states to do so. Israel has condemned the move, voicing strong criticism. France 24’s Bénédicte Paviot reports on the reaction in the United Kingdom.

items.title: United Kingdom recognises Palestinian state in major diplomatic shift
items.standfirst: Minister Keir Starmer has released a pre-recorded video message on his YouTube channel and other social media platforms, announcing that the United Kingdom now formally recognises the State of Palestine. This makes the UK the 148th of the UN’s 193 member states to do so. Israel has opposed the move, issuing strong criticism. Professor of International Politics and Middle East Studies at Lancaster University, Simon Mabon, provides further explanations.
items.content: Minister Keir Starmer has released a pre-recorded video message on his YouTube channel and other social media platforms, announcing that the United Kingdom now formally recognises the State of Palestine. This makes the UK the 148th of the UN’s 193 member states to do so. Israel has opposed the move, issuing strong criticism. Professor of International Politics and Middle East Studies at Lancaster University, Simon Mabon, provides further explanations.

items.title: United Kingdom recognises Palestinian state: Move opposed by Israel and US
items.standfirst: Prime Minister Keir Starmer has released a pre-recorded video message on his YouTube channel and other social media platforms, announcing that the United Kingdom now formally recognises the State of Palestine. This makes the UK the 148th of the UN’s 193 member states to do so. Israel has opposed the move, issuing strong criticism. France24 International Affairs editor Leela Jacinto provides further details on this western diplomatic shift and reactions.
items.content: Prime Minister Keir Starmer has released a pre-recorded video message on his YouTube channel and other social media platforms, announcing that the United Kingdom now formally recognises the State of Palestine. This makes the UK the 148th of the UN’s 193 member states to do so. Israel has opposed the move, issuing strong criticism. France24 International Affairs editor Leela Jacinto provides further details on this western diplomatic shift and reactions.

items.title: UK recognises Palestine: A diplomatic failure for Israeli PM Netanyahu
items.standfirst: Prime Minister Keir Starmer has released a pre-recorded video message announcing that the United Kingdom now formally recognises the State of Palestine. France 24 correspondent Noga Tarnopolsky reports from Jerusalem on the reactions among Israelis and the perception of a diplomatic setback for Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu.
items.content: Prime Minister Keir Starmer has released a pre-recorded video message announcing that the United Kingdom now formally recognises the State of Palestine. France 24 correspondent Noga Tarnopolsky reports from Jerusalem on the reactions among Israelis and the perception of a diplomatic setback for Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu.

items.title: UK recognises Palestine: West Bank welcomes the move
items.standfirst: Prime Minister Keir Starmer has released a pre-recorded video message on his YouTube channel and other social media platforms, announcing that the United Kingdom now formally recognises the State of Palestine. This makes the UK the 148th of the UN’s 193 member states to do so. Israel has opposed the move, issuing strong criticism. France 24’s Senior Reporter Catherine Norris Trent has the latest from Ramallah in the West Bank.
items.content: Prime Minister Keir Starmer has released a pre-recorded video message on his YouTube channel and other social media platforms, announcing that the United Kingdom now formally recognises the State of Palestine. This makes the UK the 148th of the UN’s 193 member states to do so. Israel has opposed the move, issuing strong criticism. France 24’s Senior Reporter Catherine Norris Trent has the latest from Ramallah in the West Bank.

items.title: United Kingdom recognises Palestinian State: British PM Starmer delivers a video-message
items.standfirst: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer shared a pre-recorded video message on his YouTube channel and other social media, in which he announced that the United Kingdom officially recognises the State of Palestine. The UK becomes the 148th of the UN’s 193 member states to recognise Palestine, collectively known as the occupied Palestinian territories. International affairs editor Leela Jacinto provides further details.
items.content: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer shared a pre-recorded video message on his YouTube channel and other social media, in which he announced that the United Kingdom officially recognises the State of Palestine. The UK becomes the 148th of the UN’s 193 member states to recognise Palestine, collectively known as the occupied Palestinian territories. International affairs editor Leela Jacinto provides further details.

items.title: United Kingdom recognises Palestinian state in major diplomatic shift
items.standfirst: United Kingdom is set to recognise the Palestinian state, with a videomessage pre-recorded by the British Prime Minister Keir Starmer which will significantly change the foreign policy of the country. France24 Benedicte Paviot reports the latest from London.
items.content: United Kingdom is set to recognise the Palestinian state, with a videomessage pre-recorded by the British Prime Minister Keir Starmer which will significantly change the foreign policy of the country. France24 Benedicte Paviot reports the latest from London.

items.title: United Kingdom: British PM Starmer prepares to recognise Palestinian state
items.standfirst: The United Kingdom is set to recognise the Palestinian state via a pre-recorded video message from Prime Minister Keir Starmer, marking a significant shift in the country’s foreign policy. France 24’s Bénédicte Paviot reports from London on the political and public reactions
items.content: The United Kingdom is set to recognise the Palestinian state via a pre-recorded video message from Prime Minister Keir Starmer, marking a significant shift in the country’s foreign policy. France 24’s Bénédicte Paviot reports from London on the political and public reactions

items.title: Western shift: UK and Portugal to recognise Palestinian state
items.standfirst: Britain and Portugal are set to recognise the State of Palestine on Sunday, ahead of a key week at the UN General Assembly in New York, where around 10 countries may follow suit to pressure Israel over Gaza. UK media report that Prime Minister Keir Starmer will announce the move despite strong Israeli opposition. Professor of law, conflict and global development at the University of Reading, Rosa Freedman, joins us for more.
items.content: Britain and Portugal are set to recognise the State of Palestine on Sunday, ahead of a key week at the UN General Assembly in New York, where around 10 countries may follow suit to pressure Israel over Gaza. UK media report that Prime Minister Keir Starmer will announce the move despite strong Israeli opposition. Professor of law, conflict and global development at the University of Reading, Rosa Freedman, joins us for more.

items.standfirst: Sir Keir Starmer has announced the UK has officially recognised Palestine as a state.
items.content: Sir Keir Starmer has announced the UK has officially recognised Palestine as a state.

UK media report that Prime Minister Keir Starmer will announce the move despite strong Israeli opposition. France 24’s Bénédicte Paviot reports from London.
items.content: Britain and Portugal are set to recognize the State of Palestine on Sunday, ahead of a key week at the UN General Assembly in New York, where around 10 countries may follow suit to pressure Israel over Gaza. UK media report that Prime Minister Keir Starmer will announce the move despite strong Israeli opposition. France 24’s Bénédicte Paviot reports from London.

ai_summary: The UK announced formal recognition of Palestine as an independent state, a symbolic move.
Canada and Australia also declared recognition of Palestine ahead of a UN conference.
Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu criticized the recognition as a reward for terrorism.
The announcement followed pressure on Keir Starmer from within the Labour party.
The UK's move is a major foreign policy shift for the Labour government.

clusters.title: Heathrow warns of second day of disruption after cyber-attack
clusters.neutral_headline: Cyberattack Causes Airport Disruptions in Europe

items.title: Heathrow warns of second day of disruption after cyber-attack
items.standfirst: The issue affecting check-in and baggage systems caused hundreds of delays and cancellations on Saturday.
items.content: The issue affecting check-in and baggage systems caused hundreds of delays and cancellations on Saturday.

items.title: Disruption continues at Heathrow, Brussels and Berlin airports after cyber-attack
items.standfirst: Zaventem asks airlines to cancel half of Monday departures, while most of Heathrow flights expected to operate Hundreds of thousands of passengers at Heathrow and Berlin airports faced flight delays on Sunday after a cyber-attack hit check-in desk software, while cancellations at Brussels airport suggested that disruption of Europe’s air travel would continue into Monday.Airlines were forced to revert to slower manual check-ins from Friday night after the attack hit Collins Aerospace, which provides check-in desk technology to various airlines. Continue reading...
items.content: Zaventem asks airlines to cancel half of Monday departures, while most of Heathrow flights expected to operate Hundreds of thousands of passengers at Heathrow and Berlin airports faced flight delays on Sunday after a cyber-attack hit check-in desk software, while cancellations at Brussels airport suggested that disruption of Europe’s air travel would continue into Monday.Airlines were forced to revert to slower manual check-ins from Friday night after the attack hit Collins Aerospace, which provides check-in desk technology to various airlines. Continue reading...

items.title: Hundreds of flights delayed at Heathrow and other airports after apparent cyberattack
items.standfirst: Travelers at major European airports including Heathrow, Brussels, and Berlin faced significant delays this weekend following what Collins Aerospace described as a “cyber-related incident.”
items.content: Travelers at major European airports including Heathrow, Brussels, and Berlin faced significant delays this weekend following what Collins Aerospace described as a “cyber-related incident.”

items.title: European airports scramble to get back online after cyberattack on check-in systems
items.standfirst: Several of Europe's biggest airports including London Heathrow raced to restore normal operations on Sunday after hackersdisrupted automatic check-in systems, causing a second day of delays and cancellations and forcing Brussels airport to scrap half of Monday's scheduled departing flights.
items.content: Several of Europe's biggest airports including London Heathrow raced to restore normal operations on Sunday after hackersdisrupted automatic check-in systems, causing a second day of delays and cancellations and forcing Brussels airport to scrap half of Monday's scheduled departing flights.

items.title: Cyberattack causes travel chaos at European airports
items.standfirst: A cyberattack on check-in software developed by Collins Aerospace has disrupted flights at Heathrow, Brussels and Berlin
items.content: A cyberattack on check-in software developed by Collins Aerospace has disrupted flights at Heathrow, Brussels and Berlin

items.title: Cyberattack bring chaos to airports: Who is behind this outage?
items.standfirst: Major international airports across Europe, including London’s Heathrow and Berlin’s Brandenburg, are still experiencing operational disruptions after a suspected cyberattack hit their check-in systems, leading to cancellations and delays for thousands of passengers. Anita Mendiratta, strategic advisor in tourism and aviation, provides further insight.
items.content: Major international airports across Europe, including London’s Heathrow and Berlin’s Brandenburg, are still experiencing operational disruptions after a suspected cyberattack hit their check-in systems, leading to cancellations and delays for thousands of passengers. Anita Mendiratta, strategic advisor in tourism and aviation, provides further insight.

items.title: Europe Air Travel Snarls Continue After Cyberattack
items.standfirst: Airports in Berlin, London and Brussels faced continued delays on Sunday after a cyberattack on a key airline check-in system forced staff to process passengers manually.
items.content: Airports in Berlin, London and Brussels faced continued delays on Sunday after a cyberattack on a key airline check-in system forced staff to process passengers manually.

items.title: Passengers stranded at Heathrow, other European airports after cyberattack
items.standfirst: A cyberattack targeting a service provider for check-in and boarding systems has disrupted operations at several major European airports
items.content: A cyberattack targeting a service provider for check-in and boarding systems has disrupted operations at several major European airports

ai_summary: A cyberattack hit check-in systems, causing delays and cancellations at several airports.
Heathrow, Brussels, and Berlin airports experienced significant disruptions due to the attack.
Airlines reverted to manual check-ins after the attack on Collins Aerospace.
Brussels airport canceled half of its Monday departures due to the cyberattack.
The attack affected check-in desk software, causing travel chaos.

items.title: Thousands gather at Charlie Kirk memorial in Arizona where Trump to pay tribute to slain organizer
items.standfirst: US Secret Service leads massive security presence, while conservatives demand punishment of those who disparaged rightwing ‘youth whisperer’Charlie Kirk memorial – latest updatesThousands were gathering in Arizona for a public memorial to honor Charlie Kirk, the rightwing youth organizer who was fatally shot during an event at a Utah college.Donald Trump, his vice-president, JD Vance, and Kirk’s widow, Erika Kirk, were among a long list of prominent officials and figures expected to pay tribute to the slain activist, a reflection of his deep imprint on the president’s Make America Great Again (Maga) movement. Continue reading...

With organizers aiming for one of the largest anti-corruption turnouts, authorities deployed police and soldiers on Sunday to prevent potential violence. Florent Marchais has this story.

items.standfirst: On this "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" broadcast, French President Emmanuel Macron and IBM vice chairman Gary Cohn join Margaret Brennan.
items.content: On this "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" broadcast, French President Emmanuel Macron and IBM vice chairman Gary Cohn join Margaret Brennan.

items.title: 9/21: Face the Nation
items.standfirst: This week on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan," with the United Nations General Assembly set to begin Monday in New York, French President Emmanuel Macron told Margaret Brennan that he plans to ask the U.N. to formalize his country's decision to recognize a Palestinian state. Plus, IBM vice chairman Gary Cohn joins.
items.content: This week on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan," with the United Nations General Assembly set to begin Monday in New York, French President Emmanuel Macron told Margaret Brennan that he plans to ask the U.N. to formalize his country's decision to recognize a Palestinian state. Plus, IBM vice chairman Gary Cohn joins.

items.title: Former Trump economic official Gary Cohn says "we've seen the job market degrade"
items.standfirst: Gary Cohn, IBM vice chair and director of the National Economic Council in the first Trump term, said for companies in a "very difficult environment," cutting down on the cost of labor is "the one lever they can pull."
items.content: Gary Cohn, IBM vice chair and director of the National Economic Council in the first Trump term, said for companies in a "very difficult environment," cutting down on the cost of labor is "the one lever they can pull."

items.content: In an interview with CBS News' "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan," the French president pushed back on criticism for recognizing a Palestinian state.

items.title: Face the Nation: Macron

items.content: Missed the second half of the show? French President Emmanuel Macron joins.

items.title: Transcript: Gary Cohn on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan," Sept. 21, 2025
items.standfirst: The following is the transcript of the interview with Gary Cohn, IBM vice chairman and former director of the U.S. National Economic Council, that aired on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" on Sept. 21, 2025.
items.content: The following is the transcript of the interview with Gary Cohn, IBM vice chairman and former director of the U.S. National Economic Council, that aired on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" on Sept. 21, 2025.

items.title: Former Trump official Gary Cohn notes "job market degrade," though it may be "temporary"
items.standfirst: As Federal Reserve chairman Jerome Powell said the U.S. economy is "cooling off," IBM vice chairman Gary Cohn, who served as director of the White House economic council in the first Trump administration, tells "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" that "it may be temporary …. But the reality is we have seen the job market degrade."
items.content: As Federal Reserve chairman Jerome Powell said the U.S. economy is "cooling off," IBM vice chairman Gary Cohn, who served as director of the White House economic council in the first Trump administration, tells "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" that "it may be temporary …. But the reality is we have seen the job market degrade."

items.title: Macron says hostage release is a "requirement" before embassy opens in a Palestinian state
items.standfirst: French President Emmanuel Macron tells "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" that he plans this week at the U.N. General Assembly to formalize his country's decision to recognize a Palestinian state. But, he added that it is a "requirement" that Hamas release the remaining hostages before France would open an embassy.
items.content: French President Emmanuel Macron tells "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" that he plans this week at the U.N. General Assembly to formalize his country's decision to recognize a Palestinian state. But, he added that it is a "requirement" that Hamas release the remaining hostages before France would open an embassy.

items.title: Macron calls U.S. Ambassador Charles Kushner's criticism of France "unacceptable" for diplomat
items.standfirst: French President Emmanuel Macron tells "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" that it is "unacceptable" for a diplomat to make public criticism after U.S. Ambassador Charles Kushner recently said he had not done enough to combat antisemitism in France.
items.content: French President Emmanuel Macron tells "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" that it is "unacceptable" for a diplomat to make public criticism after U.S. Ambassador Charles Kushner recently said he had not done enough to combat antisemitism in France.

items.title: Macron says "there is no mistake" in Russian drone incursions into NATO airspace
items.standfirst: President Trump suggested last week that it could have been a mistake when Russian drones invaded Polish airspace, although Russian drones then invaded Romanian airspace. French President Emmanuel Macron tells "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" that "there is no mistake."
items.content: President Trump suggested last week that it could have been a mistake when Russian drones invaded Polish airspace, although Russian drones then invaded Romanian airspace. French President Emmanuel Macron tells "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" that "there is no mistake."

items.title: Open: This is "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan," Sept. 21, 2025

Plus, IBM vice chairman Gary Cohn joins.
items.content: This week on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan," with the United Nations General Assembly set to begin Monday in New York, French President Emmanuel Macron told Margaret Brennan that he plans to ask the U.N. to formalize his country's decision to recognize a Palestinian state. Plus, IBM vice chairman Gary Cohn joins.

items.title: Gaza, Palestinian state recognition set to dominate UN General Assembly summit
items.standfirst: Saudi Arabia and France will co-chair meetings at the UN General Assembly summit beginning Monday on a two-state solution to the Israeli-Palestinian conflict. The French presidency said Friday that 10 countries would formally recognise Palestinian statehood during the summit.
items.content: Saudi Arabia and France will co-chair meetings at the UN General Assembly summit beginning Monday on a two-state solution to the Israeli-Palestinian conflict. The French presidency said Friday that 10 countries would formally recognise Palestinian statehood during the summit.

clusters.title: German jets scrambled after Russian military plane flies over Baltic Sea

items.title: German jets scrambled after Russian military plane flies over Baltic Sea
items.standfirst: Russian Il-20M reconnaissance plane ignored requests to make contact, in latest of what are seen as provocative acts by KremlinTwo German Eurofighter jets were scrambled on Sunday to intercept a Russian military aircraft above the Baltic Sea, as Estonia said it would call an emergency meeting of the UN security council after Russian planes violated its airspace.Germany’s air force said the Russian Il-20M reconnaissance plane had switched off its transponders and ignored requests to make contact. The Eurofighters took off from the Rostock-Laage airbase to head off the aircraft as it flew in international airspace. Continue reading...
items.content: Russian Il-20M reconnaissance plane ignored requests to make contact, in latest of what are seen as provocative acts by KremlinTwo German Eurofighter jets were scrambled on Sunday to intercept a Russian military aircraft above the Baltic Sea, as Estonia said it would call an emergency meeting of the UN security council after Russian planes violated its airspace.Germany’s air force said the Russian Il-20M reconnaissance plane had switched off its transponders and ignored requests to make contact. The Eurofighters took off from the Rostock-Laage airbase to head off the aircraft as it flew in international airspace. Continue reading...

The bomb was undetonated.

clusters.neutral_headline: Russian Jets Violate Estonian Airspace

items.title: Estonia seeks Nato consultation after Russian jets violate airspace
items.standfirst: Russia denies jets entered Estonian airspace in the same month as its drones violated the airspace of two other Nato members.
items.content: Russia denies jets entered Estonian airspace in the same month as its drones violated the airspace of two other Nato members.

items.title: Russian Warplanes Breach Nato Airspace
items.standfirst: Estonia has asked to consult other Nato members after warplanes violated its airspace.
items.content: Estonia has asked to consult other Nato members after warplanes violated its airspace.

ai_summary: Estonia seeks NATO consultation after Russian jets violated airspace.
Russia denies its jets entered Estonian airspace.
The violation occurred in the same month as drone incursions.
The drones violated the airspace of two other NATO members.
Estonia has asked to consult other NATO members.
